plugin.name: lsof
plugin.description: Detects resources out in the network using lsof technology

server.name: Network Resource Detector
server.description: A resource that is used to detect network resources.

c:simple-property.name: detectionMechanism
c:simple-property.description: Determines how to perform network resource detection. 'external' means that an external executable tool (e.g. lsof) will be used; 'internal' means internal Java detection code provided by the RHQ plugin will be used.

c:simple-property.name: executable
c:simple-property.description: The full path to the external executable to be used. If not defined, you must select 'internal' for the detection mechanism. This is ignored if using the 'internal' detection mechanism.

c:simple-property.name: workingDirectory
c:simple-property.description: When the external executable is invoked, this will be its working directory. This is ignored if using the 'internal' detection mechanism.

c:list-property.name: environmentVariables
c:list-property.description: Environment variables that are set when executing the executable. This is ignored if using the 'internal' detection mechanism.

c:simple-property.name: versionArguments
c:simple-property.description: The arguments to pass to the executable that will help determine the version of the external tool. This is ignored if using the 'internal' detection mechanism.

c:simple-property.name: versionRegex
c:simple-property.description: The regex that can pick out the version from the executable output. If the regex has a captured group, its matched content will be used as the version. If there is no captured group, the entire output will be used as the version. This is ignored if using the 'internal' detection mechanism.

operation.name: execute
operation.description: Executes the external detection executable with a set of arguments and returns the output and exit code. This is only useful when configured to use the external detection mechanism. If this resource is not configured to use the external mechanism, invoking this operation will fail.

c:simple-property.name: arguments
c:simple-property.description: The arguments to pass to the executable.

operation.name: getNetworkConnections
operation.description: Determines the network connections currently established on the machine

c:simple-property.name: arguments
c:simple-property.description: The arguments to pass to the executable. This parameter will be ignored if using the 'internal' detection mechanism.

c:simple-property.name: regex
c:simple-property.description: Regular expression used to parse each line of the output of the external executable. This regex must have capture groups that match the output fields as defined in the results metadata. This parameter will be ignored if using the 'internal' detection mechanism.

c:simple-property.name: detectionMechanism
c:simple-property.description: Describes the mechanism that was used to peform the detection.

c:list-property.name: networkConnections
c:list-property.description: The active network connections that were detected

c:map-property.name: networkConnection
c:map-property.description: An active network connection that was detected

c:simple-property.name: localHost
c:simple-property.default: The address of the local side of the connection

c:simple-property.name: localPort
c:simple-property.default: The port of the local side of the connection

c:simple-property.name: remoteHost
c:simple-property.default: The address of the remote side of the connection

c:simple-property.name: remotePort
c:simple-property.default: The port of the remote side of the connection
